intro: Planchonella stenosepala, commonly known as the narrow-sepaled pandanus, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its robust, fibrous roots and thick, waxy leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that develop into fleshy, orange-red berries. Its foliage is often used in traditional crafts and as a decorative element in landscaping. Due to its hardy nature, it is well-suited for humid, coastal environments.
